summary: T. Jeremy Gunn was a member of the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB). The documents indicate his involvement in various aspects of the ARRB's work, including security clearances for board members, formal determinations regarding the public disclosure of CIA records related to the JFK assassination, multi-agency declassification reviews, and correspondence with the CIA and other agencies regarding compliance with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act. He was involved in requesting additional information and records from the CIA, addressing concerns about the pace of declassification, and ensuring the release of relevant materials. Gunn's work spanned from the mid-1990s to the late 1990s, as the ARRB worked to fulfill its mandate under the JFK Act.
significance: T. Jeremy Gunn's significance lies in his role as a member of the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB), which was responsible for reviewing and declassifying government records related to the JFK assassination. His involvement in the ARRB's activities, including interactions with various government agencies and efforts to ensure compliance with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act, contributed to the public release of information related to the assassination.
